section BoxProperties
  open MeasureTheory EuclideanSpace FiniteDimensional

  variable {n : ‚Ñï+}
  variable {E' : Type*} [EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù n E']

  -- Lemma: For any box `B` and any `œÅ > 0`, there exists `k : ‚Ñï` such that all boxes in `Box.subdivide_all B k`
  -- have side lengths less than `œÅ`.
  lemma Box.exists_subdivision_all_sideLengths_lt (B : Box E') (œÅ : ‚Ñù) (hœÅ_pos : 0 < œÅ) :
      ‚àÉ k : ‚Ñï, (Box.subdivide_all B k).toFinset.all (fun B' => B'.sideLengths.all (fun l => l < œÅ)) := by
    -- Each subdivision halves the side lengths.
    -- The maximum side length of `B` is `B.max_side_length`.
    -- After `k` subdivisions, the maximum side length will be `B.max_side_length / 2^k`.
    -- We need `B.max_side_length / 2^k < œÅ`.
    -- This is `B.max_side_length < œÅ * 2^k`.
    -- `B.max_side_length / œÅ < 2^k`.
    -- `log‚ÇÇ (B.max_side_length / œÅ) < k`.
    -- We can choose `k = ‚åàlog‚ÇÇ (B.max_side_length / œÅ)‚åâ + 1` (if `B.max_side_length > 0`).

    -- We need `B.max_side_length` to be defined for `Box`.
    -- Mathlib's `MeasureTheory.Box` does have `sideLengths` which is a `List ‚Ñù‚â•0`.
    -- `max_side_length` is not directly defined on `Box` itself but on its `sideLengths`.
    -- Instead, we can use `B.sup_sub_inf_le_of_le`.
    -- Or, `Box.sideLengths.max` is `List.max` on `‚Ñù‚â•0`.
    -- For `EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù n`, `Box` is `Prod i, Set.Icc a_i b_i`. In `Mathlib` `Box` is `Prod i, Ioc lower_i upper_i`.
    -- The length of side `i` is `upper_i - lower_i`.
    -- `Box.upper - Box.lower`.
    let M : ‚Ñù := (B.upper : TopProdLimit.Coord n ‚Ñù) - (B.lower : TopProdLimit.Coord n ‚Ñù).max
    by_cases hM_pos : 0 < M
    ¬∑ let val := M / œÅ
      have h_val_pos : 0 < val := div_pos hM_pos hœÅ_pos
      -- Use a helper lemma for `exists_pow_two_gt_of_pos_real` with real.
      obtain ‚ü®k, hk‚ü© : ‚àÉ k : ‚Ñï, val < (2 : ‚Ñù) ^ k := exists_pow_two_gt val
      use k
      intro B' hB'
      simp only [List.mem_toFinset] at hB'
      -- `Box.sideLengths_le_of_subdivide_all` (a different one, `Box.subdivide_all_sideLengths_le_half_pow`)
      -- implies side lengths are reduced.
      -- The `Box.subdivide_all` ensures that each coordinate is bisected repeatedly.
      -- So if original `B` has side lengths `l_i`, new boxes `B'` have side lengths `l_i / 2^k`.
      -- The `max` side length of `B'` is `max l_i / 2^k`.
      have max_side_len_B'_le : B'.sideLengths.max (by simp).toReal ‚â§ M / (2^k) :=
        B.max_side_length_subdivide_all_le B' hB' k
      intro l hl
      apply lt_of_le_of_lt (le_trans (List.le_max_of_mem hl) max_side_len_B'_le)
      calc
        M / (2^k) < œÅ := by gcongr; exact hk
    ¬∑ -- `M ‚â§ 0`. Since side lengths are non-negative, this implies `M = 0`.
      -- This means all side lengths are 0.
      have hM_eq_0 : M = 0 := le_antisymm hM_pos (by positivity)
      use 0 -- k=0 means no subdivision.
      intro B' hB'
      have hB'_eq_B : B' = B := by
        simp only [List.mem_toFinset, Box.subdivide_all_zero] at hB'
        exact hB'
      rw [hB'_eq_B]
      intro l hl
      have B_max_side_len_eq_0 : (B.sideLengths.max (by simp)).toReal = 0 := by
        have := Finset.toList.map (fun (i : Fin n) => (B.upper (i) - B.lower (i)))
        have : List.max (B.sideLengths.map Real.toReal) _ = 0 := sorry -- This would be true if M=0
        sorry -- this part is tricky, `Box.max_side_length` property should imply `M=0`
      exact lt_of_le_of_lt (List.le_max_of_mem hl) (by simp [B_max_side_len_eq_0, hM_eq_0, hœÅ_pos])

  lemma Box.subdivide_all_union (B : Box E') (k : ‚Ñï) :
      B.toSet = ‚ãÉ (B' ‚àà (Box.subdivide_all B k).toFinset), (B'.toSet : Set E') := by
    rw [‚ÜêFinset.coe_iUnion]
    rw [Box.toSet_eq_iUnion_toSet_of_subdivide_all B k]
    rfl

  lemma Box.volume_sum_subdivide_all (B : Box E') (k : ‚Ñï) :
      ‚àë B' in (Box.subdivide_all B k).toFinset, B'.volume = B.volume := by
    rw [‚ÜêFinset.sum_attach]
    rw [List.sum_attach _ _ (Box.subdivide_all B k) (fun B' => B'.volume)]
    exact Box.volume_sum_subdivide_all B k

  -- This property states that interiors of subdivided boxes are pairwise disjoint.
  lemma Box.subdivide_all_disjoint_interiors (B : Box E') (k : ‚Ñï) :
      (Box.subdivide_all B k).toFinset.PairwiseDisjoint (fun B' => B'.Ioo) := by
    -- This relies on `Box.pairwise_disjoint_on_box_interiors` from `BoxIntegral.Box`
    exact (Box.subdivide_all B k).pairwise_disjoint_on_box_interiors

  -- Helper for `sum_biUnion` when boxes are disjoint.
  lemma Finset.sum_biUnion_boxes {Œ± Œ≤ : Type*} [AddCommMonoid Œ≤] (S : Finset Œ±) (F : Œ± ‚Üí Finset (Box E'))
      (h_pairwise_disjoint : (S.biUnion F).PairwiseDisjoint (fun b => b.toSet.interior)) :
      ‚àë x in S.biUnion F, x.volume = ‚àë a in S, ‚àë b in F a, b.volume := by
    -- This is derived from `Finset.sum_biUnion` with proper disjointness proof.
    sorry

  -- Lemma that the max side length is reduced when subdividing
  lemma Box.max_side_length_subdivide_all_le (B' : Box E') (hB' : B' ‚àà (Box.subdivide_all B k).toFinset) (k : ‚Ñï) :
    (B'.sideLengths.max (by simp)).toReal ‚â§ (B.sideLengths.max (by simp)).toReal / (2^k) := by
    -- This follows from `Box.sideLengths_le_of_subdivide_all` and property of `List.max`
    sorry

end BoxProperties
